author: bridge-bot
content:
<dankrad> Thinking about it, I think it does not make any difference. accessing 3 elements in the suffix tree has very minimal overhead over accessing 1. That's what we actually optimized for. So for the witnesses and witness verification it barely matters.

For database size, I guess the only question is if you can simply store these values in a compressed form. Or is there a fundamental reason why you'd keep them as 32 byte values?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> If for some reason it is much easier to implement the database if you compress these values into one, and that is actually a majority of the state data storage, then yes I would agree that this is a worthy consideration
